author: he852100
body:
When the command starts, it cannot be canceled. And the returned data has no value.I got `0.0.0.0.0`

It took me about eight minutes to execute this command
```powershell
PS /> (Test-Connection -TargetName www.huojia1.com -Traceroute).Replies|Format-Table ReplyRouterAddress,ReplyRouterName,hop
^C
^[OA^[OB^[OD^[OC^[OB    ^[
```

```powershell
Measure-Command{(Test-Connection -TargetName www.huojia1.com -Traceroute -TimeoutSeconds 1).Replies|Format-Table ReplyRouterAddress,ReplyRouterName,hop}

ReplyRouterAddress ReplyRouterName Hop
------------------ --------------- ---                          0.0.0.0                              1
0.0.0.0                              2
0.0.0.0                              3
0.0.0.0                              4                          0.0.0.0                              5
0.0.0.0                              6
0.0.0.0                              7
0.0.0.0                              8
0.0.0.0                              9
0.0.0.0                             10
0.0.0.0                             11
0.0.0.0                             12
0.0.0.0                             13
0.0.0.0                             14
0.0.0.0                             15


TotalMinutes      : 7.32902652833333
```

```powershell
Name                           Value                            ----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.5                  PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.5
OS                             Linux 4.9.112-perf #1 SMP PREEM…

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.3
OS                             Linux 4.18.0-80.11.2.el8_…
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Traceroutes on Linux are very much not super functional I'm afraid. We're relying on .net core's ping API for that, and we don't get much information from it on Unix OSes.

I think #10697 is my PR which should help _some_ but it's still not great. We're trying to get .net core to improve the API functionality, but I've not heard a great deal from them as yet.

See https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/28934

Loose like they're content to wait till .net 5 which is a bit disappointing. Perhaps adding your voice there will give them a bit of a reason to prioritise it, but they don't seem especially keen to get it sorted out.

Cc @iSazonov @SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: he852100
comments.body:
Ping fails when using tun
```powershell
ip add|Select-String -Pattern "tun0"

137: tun0: <POINTOPOINT,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc pfifo_fast state UNKNOWN group default qlen 500
    inet 26.26.26.1/30 scope global tun0
```
```powershell
PS /root> Test-Connection jd.com
Destination: jd.com

Ping Source           Address                   Latency BufferSize Status
                                                   (ms)        (B)
---- ------           -------                   ------- ---------- ------
   1 localhost        *                               *          * TimedOut
   2 localhost        *                               *          * TimedOut
   3 localhost        *                               *          * TimedOut
   4 localhost        *                               *          * TimedOut

PS /root>
```

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as fixed and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: [My bug report]Traceroute Problem
